Client.description: Used for screen connectivity general configuration

default: When EGUSEWIN AUTH value is set to No, the default path is: RTRA\RTClient1
When EGUSEWIN AUTH value is set to Yes, the default path is: RTRA RTClient username
Client.description: Indicates the Robotic Automation Client user name

Indicates the Robotic Automation Client conversation timeout in milliseconds.
Indicates how the Client should act in Robotic Automation mode. If you select Yes, then on startup, this will force activate autoupdate & RTI Launcher.

Indicates how often the Real-Time Client sends the last event for the Process, Agent and Application states after a change occurs. If no change has occurred, no notification is sent
Indicates whether or not to install the WPF connector.
When set to 1 or omitted, indicates that write settings are to the Application Data folder. When set to 0, write settings are not to the Robotic Automation Application Data folder.
When set to 1 or omitted, indicates that write settings are to the Application Data folder. When set to 0, write settings are not to the Application Data folder.
Installation directory
Used for screen connectivity general configuration.
Show the error dialog
Enable or disable the Real-Time Client API.
Defines the Real- Time Client API highest port number in the available port range.
Defines the Real-Time Client API lowest port number in the available port range.
The Real-Time Client API port number.

Defines the Real-Time Client API unique identifier to be used. WindowsUsernameOnly Example: johns WindowsUsernameWithDomain Example: nice_ systems\johns WindowsUsernameWithFQDN Example: nice.com\johnsMachineNameWithSessionId Example:<machine_name>.<session_id>
Determines whether the Real-Time Client API is set to shared resource mode (for example,Citrix). Set this to True when using a shared resource environment.
When set to 1, the Client and Designer work without a server in standalone mode.
Determines that the Real-Time Client will use the Domain during log on.
Controls the behavior of the login. When set to True, the login is silent and the login form is not shown to the user. When set to False, the login is manual and the login form is shown to the user.

ITI.description: Describes the actual text which will appear if pause failure occurs.
Describes the actual text which will appear when pause success occurs.
Describes the actual text which will appear if resume recording failure occurs.
Describes the actual text which will appear when resume recording success occurs.
Show callout for feedback on recording automation actions.
Indicates whether or not to install the ITI Bridge side by side.
Describes the actual text which will appear in the event of start recording failure.
Describes the actual text which appears in the event of start recording success.
Describes the actual text which appears in the event of stop recording failure.
Describes the actual text which appears in the event of stop recording success.
Indicates whether to use an unique Operating System login.

RTAM.description: Indicates whether or not to install RTAMs desktop monitoring component.
Indicates whether or not to install RTAMs process monitoring component.
Indicates whether the aggregator is in use and if so, which protocol is used.
How the Real-Time Client should act.
When set to 1, indicates that the application usage module should work in Citrix server mode.
